text:
An association of 15 residents’ welfare groups is planning to hold a water festival near Perungudi Lake —Photo: Shaju John

In order to sustain efforts to save water bodies in their neighbourhood, residents of Perungudi are planning to hold a ‘water festival’ near Perungudi lake in January.

Competitions

The Perungudi Lake Area Neighbourhood Forum (PLAN), which is an association of over 15 residents’ welfare groups, is planning to host competitions for school children on the role the lake has in their lives.

Ahead of the event, members of PLAN have been cleaning the lake. The waterbody is the major groundwater recharge for several neighbouring colonies, which still use groundwater for cooking and drinking purposes.

Selvakumar Royan, a resident of Kurinji Nagar, Perungudi, said: “Washing of clothes and open defecation have become common along the lake. We want to create awareness about the need to protect the lake that is brimming with water and attract attention of birds.”

The best entries in various contests, including photography, poetry and essay writing, will be on display at the water fest.
